dm: This command DM's a specific user a message of your choice.

This command excepts two arguments, *user* and *message*.

*user* can either be a mention of the user, or the users name, if they are already added to the dictionary.

*message* is the message you would like to send to the user. Emotes can be used if the bot is in the same server as the emotes origin.
dmrep: Similar to the dm command except it repeats the message to the user until stopped with stop command.

This command excepts two arguments, *user* and *message*.

*user* can either be a mention of the user, or the users name, if they are already added to the dictionary.

*interval* is the number of seconds you would like the bot to wait betweeen messages. This can be almost any number between 1-100 including decimals.

*message* is the message you would like to send to the user. Emotes can be used if the bot is in the same server as the emotes origin.
stop: Stops the repeated messages to user from the *dmrep* command.
addme: If user is not defined in dictionary, this command can be used by a user to add them to the dictionary.

This command accepts one argument, *name*

*name* is the name you would like to be stored as in the dictionary.
addusr: If user who is now you is not defined in dictionary, this command can be used by user to add to dictionary

This command accepts two arguments, *user* and *name*

*user* is the mention of the user you would like to add

*name* is the name you would like the user to be to be stored as in the database.
ping: Sends 'pong' along with the bot's ping in milliseconds.
working: Are you working or not? (switch statement)
If you are working it will add you to the database and if you are pinged it will send a message letting the person who pinged you know that you are working.
busy: Are you busy or not? (switch statement)
If you are busy it will add you to the database and if you are pinged it will send a message letting the person who pinged you know that you are busy.
compliment: Sends a nice message to user based on user id.
cmdban:
This command accepts one argument, *user*

*user* is the mention of the user you would like to ban from using commands.
cmduban:
This command accepts one argument, *user*

*user* is the mention of the user you would like to unban from using commands.
info: Sends the info of the mentioned user that has been stored in the database

This command accepts one argument, *user*

*user* is the mention of the user you would like to get the name for.
editname:
Changes the current name for the user in the database to *name*.

This command only works for the user who uses the command, you are not allowed to change another users name.

This command accepts one argument, *name*

*name* is the name you would like to be put in the database under your profile.
update: Sends the updated code to a list of channels that it is authorized to send to, can only be used by the author of the bot.
auth: Use this command in a channel you would like to authorize so code updates will be sent periodically by the author.

This command accepts one argument, *region*

*region* is the region you are located in so updates will send with the correct timestamp, the only regions that are currently supported are CST, PST, and EST.
authtz:
This command changes the region of an authorized channel.
This command can only be used on channels that have been authorized.

This command accepts one argument, *region*

*region* is the region you are located in so updates will send with the correct timestamp, the only regions that are currently supported are CST, PST, and EST.
rmauth:
This command removes authorization from an authorized channel.
This command can only be used on a previously authorized channel, it has no additional arguments.
poke:
This command sends a random happy emoticon back. 
This command has no additional arguments.
